name: IMO (International Mathematical Olympiad)
description: International Mathematical Olympiad problems requiring advanced mathematical reasoning, proof construction, and olympiad-level problem-solving.

metrics.name: score
metrics.definition: Total points earned on IMO problems (typically 7 points per problem, 6 problems per competition)

metrics.name: medal_threshold
metrics.definition: Whether score meets gold/silver/bronze medal cutoffs
metrics.calculation: Based on official IMO medal boundaries (gold typically ~29-33/42)

test_method: Present IMO competition problems requiring formal mathematical proofs. Evaluate solution correctness, completeness of proof, and mathematical rigor. Score using official IMO rubrics.
notes: IMO problems test combinatorics, number theory, algebra, and geometry at olympiad level. Document whether automated proof verification was used or human expert scoring. Specify which year's problems and whether hints were provided.
